sen.j: 印譜（いんぷ）とは、印籍の一種で、鑑賞や研究を目的として印章の印影および印款を中心に掲載した書籍である。
sen.e: An inpu is a kind of books on tenkoku (engraving letters on the material of a seal) a book introducing mainly inei (impressions of seals) and inkan (names of authors) for the purpose of appreciation and study.

An inpu is a kind of books on tenkoku (engraving letters on the material of a seal), that mainly introduces mainly inei (impressions of seals) and inkan (names of authors) for the purpose of appreciation and study.

An inpu is a kind of books on tenkoku (engraving letters on the material of a seal), that mainly introduces mainly inei (impressions of seals) and inkan (names of authors) for the purpose of appreciation and study.

sen.j: 原印を直接鈐した原鈐本と、模刻した印を鈐した鈐印本、木版などに写した翻刻本がある。
sen.e: It includes genreibon with original seals directly stamped, gininbon with imitated seals stamped and reprints of seals on wooden plates and so on.
It includes genkeibon, a book stamped with original seals, keninbon, a book stamped with imitated seals, and reprints of seals stamped by a wood block.
sen.cmt: 原文に沿って読み方と訳を修正しました。
sen.e: It includes genkeibon, a book stamped with original seals, keninbon, a book stamped with imitated seals, and reprints of seals stamped by a wood block.

sen.j: 中国や日本の近世・近代に文人や篆刻家によって盛んに刊行された。
sen.e: In the early modern times and modern age in China and Japan many of such books were published by people of letters and seal-engravers.
In the early modern times and modern age in China and Japan, many of such books were published by literary men and tenkokukas (artists of seal engraving).
In the early modern times and modern age in China and Japan, many of such books were published by literary men and tenkokukas (artists of seal engraving).

sen.j: 最初の印譜は、中国北宋の大観 (宋)年間に楊克一が出版した『集古印格』とされる。
sen.e: The first inpu is estimated to be "Shukoinkaku" published by YO Katsuichi in the Northern Sung Dynasty in the Taikan era.
It is said that the first inpu is "Shukoinkaku" published by YO Katsuichi in the Taikan era of the Northern Sung Dynasty.
sen.cmt: 原文に沿って修正しました。
sen.e: It is said that the first inpu is "Shukoinkaku" published by YO Katsuichi in the Taikan era of the Northern Sung Dynasty.

sen.j: 続いて宣和年間に徽宗が撰した『宣和印譜』とされるがこれは伝存していない。
sen.e: Subsequently in the Senwa era So KI was supposed to have compiled "Senwa Inpu", which does not exist today.
The second inpu is believed to be "Senwa Inpu" complied by Kiso in the Senwa era, however, that has not been handed down orally and does not exist today.
sen.cmt: 原文に沿って修正しました。
sen.e: The second inpu is believed to be "Senwa Inpu" complied by Kiso in the Senwa era, however, that has not been handed down orally and does not exist today.

sen.j: 宋 (王朝)・元 (王朝)を通じて16種の印譜が出版されたがいずれも翻刻であった。
sen.e: Sixteen inpu were published from Sung (Dynasty) through Yuan (Dynasty), all of which were reprints.
Sixteen inpu were published from Sung (Dynasty) through Yuan (Dynasty), all of which were reprints.
Sixteen inpu were published from Sung (Dynasty) through Yuan (Dynasty), all of which were reprints.

sen.j: 原鈐本が伝わる最古の印譜は明代の隆慶 (明)6年（1572年）に出版された、顧従徳の『集古印譜』である。
sen.e: The oldest inpu among genreibon is "集古印譜 (Shuko Inpu)" published by 顧従徳(KO Jutoku) in 1572. The oldest inpu among genreibon is "集古印譜 (Shuko Inpu)" published by 顧従徳 KO Jutoku) in 1572.
The oldest inpu of genkeibon is "Shuko Inpu" published by Jutoku KO in 1572.
sen.cmt: 重複した文章を一文にしました。原文に沿って修正しました。
sen.e: The oldest inpu of genkeibon is "Shuko Inpu" published by Jutoku KO in 1572.

sen.j: 初版は僅か20部であり、秦・漢の古印の印影を1700方余り集めている。
sen.e: As for the first edition which included 1700 or more impressions of old seals in Qin and Han, only two hundred copies were printed.
As for the first edition which included 1700 or more impressions of old seals in Qin and Han, only twenty copies were printed.
As for the first edition which included 1700 or more impressions of old seals in Qin and Han, only twenty copies were printed.

sen.j: 現存しているのはこのうちの1部（1帙5冊・欠1冊）である。
sen.e: One copy exists today (one of the six volumes is missing).
One of the copies exists today (One case has five volumes, but one of the volumes is missing.)
sen.cmt: 原文に沿って修正しました。
sen.e: One of the copies exists today (One case has five volumes, but one of the volumes is missing.)

sen.j: 万暦に羅王常の協力を得て翻刻し、最終的には4000方近くにまでの印影を集めた。
sen.e: In Banreki era KO Jutoku, supported by RA Ojo, reprinted seals and finally collected nearly 4000 impressions of them.
In Banreki era, Jutoku KO, supported by Ojo RA, reprinted seals and finally collected nearly 4000 impressions of them.
sen.cmt: 姓名の順序を変えました。
sen.e: In Banreki era, Jutoku KO, supported by Ojo RA, reprinted seals and finally collected nearly 4000 impressions of them.

sen.j: 増刷の過程で複数の異なった書名となり、『顧氏芸閣集古印譜』・『顧氏印藪』・『王氏秦漢印統』などがある。
sen.e: In the process of additional printings it took multiple different names such as "顧氏芸閣集古印譜 (Koshigeikakushuko Inpu)"/"顧氏印藪 (Koshi Inso "/王氏秦漢印統 (O-clan-Quin-Han Into) and so on.
sen.cmt: *『顧氏芸閣集古印譜』・『顧氏印藪』・『王氏秦漢印統』 (推定読み）
sen.e: In the process of additional printings, it took multiple different names such as "顧氏芸閣集古印譜 (Koshigeikakushuko Inpu)"/"顧氏印藪 (Koshi Inso) "/王氏秦漢印統 (Oshi shinkan into), and so on.
sen.cmt: 括弧の位置、王氏・・・の読み方を変更しました。
sen.e: In the process of additional printings, it took multiple different names such as "顧氏芸閣集古印譜 (Koshigeikakushuko Inpu)"/"顧氏印藪 (Koshi Inso) "/王氏秦漢印統 (Oshi shinkan into), and so on.

sen.j: 篆刻の黎明期と重なり、多くの篆刻家がこの印譜の啓発を受けている。
sen.e: The inpu, overlapping the dawning of tenkoku (seal-engraving), enlightened many seal engravers.
The inpu, overlapping the dawning of tenkoku (seal-engraving), enlightened many seal engravers.
The inpu, overlapping the dawning of tenkoku (seal-engraving), enlightened many seal engravers.
